extendedIngredients.name: baby beets
extendedIngredients.original: 2 lbs beet thinnings or whole baby beets with their greens (washed well and patted dry)
extendedIngredients.originalName: beet thinnings or whole baby beets with their greens (washed well and patted dry)

extendedIngredients.name: chicken stock
extendedIngredients.original: 2 cups fresh chicken broth or roasted chicken stock
extendedIngredients.originalName: fresh chicken broth or roasted chicken stock

title: don’t waste garden thinnings: a for braised whole baby beets
summary: Don’t waste garden thinnings: a for braised whole baby beets is a gluten free, primal, and vegetarian side dish. This recipe serves 6 and costs 70 cents per serving. One portion of this dish contains around 5g of protein, 9g of fat, and a total of 163 calories. 1 person found this recipe to be yummy and satisfying. Head to the store and pick up cider vinegar, mint, roasted chicken stock, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 15 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 32%. This score is not so outstanding. Similar recipes are Baby Beet Tops (with teeny weeny baby beets attached), [] Wild Rice, Baby Beetroot & Beef Kofta Salad (ft. Love Beets Baby Beetroot), and Roasted Baby Beets.
instructions: Melt butter in a skillet over a moderate flame. When it froths, neatly place beet thinnings into the skillet so that all the root tips rest in one direct and the greens in the other. Sear in butter until the greens are wilted.  Pour two cups chicken broth or chicken stock into the skillet, cover, and simmer until roots become tender – about ten minutes.Turn off the heat and transfer the beets to a serving dish using tongs.  For best presentation, lay the beets together so that all the beetroots rest at one end of the serving dish with the greens resting at the other.  Sprinkle with fresh chopped mint and dress with cider vinegar or four thieves vinegar.

steps.step: Melt butter in a skillet over a moderate flame. When it froths, neatly place beet thinnings into the skillet so that all the root tips rest in one direct and the greens in the other. Sear in butter until the greens are wilted.

Pour two cups chicken broth or chicken stock into the skillet, cover, and simmer until roots become tender – about ten minutes.Turn off the heat and transfer the beets to a serving dish using tongs.  For best presentation, lay the beets together so that all the beetroots rest at one end of the serving dish with the greens resting at the other.
Sprinkle with fresh chopped mint and dress with cider vinegar or four thieves vinegar.
